page.title: 09LANDSCAPE
page.content: Our area is fairly flat and lies in the vale at the foot of the Chiltern Escarpment. In the southern tip of the area is Shirburn Hill (830')and wood which is part of the Chilterns. There are several streams and springs in Pyrton and Shirburn where the water has drained down from the hills. In the 19th century a landscape designer used one of the underground streams to design the lake and moat system at Shirburn Castle. There is also a spring and a moat at Pyrton Manor. Looking down from the hills the block is a patchwork of fields with the odd farm or cluster of houses.
